head.supplied: Melbourne botan Garden, ¶ 18/5/66. ¶ Sir ¶ ¶ In reply to your letter of the 16 Inst. I have the honor to inform you that any morning at 9 in May the plants desired by the Warnambool Municipality will...

div.p: Letters received, box 11, Borough Council records, Warrnambool, Victoria.

Transcribed 5.10.92. To proof.
For summaries of this letter see:Minute book 6, p. 266, and Warrnambool examiner, 5 June 1866, p. 2. Melbourne botan Garden,

In reply to your letter of the 16 Inst. I have the honor to inform you that any morning at 9 in May the plants desired by the Warnambool Municipality will be supplied to a duely authorized Agent, it being understood that all arrangements for planting are completed, as maritime pines cannot be transferred readily from one locality to the other if for several days left out of the ground. It would be necessary that the planting of the pines &c be entrusted to a thorough competent gardener & that they are kept well sheltered for a while

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p:
Ferd Mueller
The Town Clerk, H. Laurie, wrote to G. Lempriere, Melbourne on 22 May 1866 requesting him to 'take the trouble of employing some one conversant with gardening, to go to the Botanical Gardens on Tuesday next, the 29th, at 9 a.m., to take delivery of a supply of plants wh have been promised to the Boro' Council by Dr Mueller. Form of authority is enclosed. After receiving the plants & packing them sufficiently, the person employed will send them to us by the steamer wh leaves Melbourne for WBool that morning.' (Letter copy book 3, pp. 35-6).
Lempriere replied on 29 May 1866 that he had been to the Melbourne Botanic Gardens that morning: 'but, notwithstanding that Dr Mueller told us — yesterday — they would be ready — the gardener who took 2 cases for them (at the request of Dr Mueller was told, they could not be got ready, until Saturday next. If received then, they will go by the 'Edina' —', (Letters received, box 11). See also H. Laurie to M, 16 May 1866, 22 May 1866.
